images.text_verbatim:
All doors shall comply with resistance to forced entry O.B.C. 9.6.6.
All exterior walls to be insulated & weatherstripped.
All windows in dwellings unit shall be exterior type, weatherstripped and caulked. Basement openings shall be non-openable. Wall separating house and garage to be insulated & weatherstripped.
All concrete to be reinforced as per O.B.C. 9.30.6.
All bedrooms shall have at least one window with unobstructed glass area of 3.8 sq. ft., with no dimension less than 15" and a sill height not above finished floor.
Grab bars up to 16" above bath tubs.
ABC CO. INC. shall not be liable for damages resulting from these drawings.
Roof snow load = 0.4 kPa; not less than 1 kPa (20.9 psf),
Building width > 4.3m
Building width <= 4.3m
Minimum snow load in kPa
S = 0.29 (6 psf) (roof rafters/joists or truss top chords)
S = 1.92 (40 psf),
S = 1.44 (30 psf)
S = 0.58 (12 psf)
Roof systems, as per OBC 9.4.2.3:
S = 1.92 kPa (40 psf) or snow load
OBC 2012 4.1.5.14 (1)
images.summary: This image contains general construction notes for a building project. Key points include compliance with O.B.C. 9.6.6 for door resistance to forced entry, insulation and weatherstripping requirements for exterior walls, and specifications for windows in dwelling units. All concrete must be reinforced as per O.B.C. 9.30.6. Bedrooms require at least one window with specific dimensions, and grab bars are to be installed up to 16 inches above bathtubs. The company ABC CO. INC. disclaims liability for damages resulting from these drawings. Roof snow load specifications are provided, with different values based on building width and roof system type, as per OBC 9.4.2.3. These notes set the stage for detailed plans and specifications that follow.

images.text_verbatim:
SITE PLAN NOTES:
1. DIMENSIONS TO PROPERTY LINES ARE APPROXIMATE. THIS IS NOT A SURVEY.
2. PROVIDE MINIMUM 2% OF SLOPE FOR ADEQUATE DRAINAGE AWAY FROM THE NEW BUILDING.
3. PROVIDE EAVESTROUGH CONNECTED TO DOWN PIPES TO STORM SEWERS OR FIELD TILES.
DIMENSIONS SHOWN ARE IN METRIC AND CAN BE CONVERTED TO IMPERIAL BY MULTIPLYING BY 3.281.
images.summary: This image contains site plan notes for a building project. The notes emphasize that dimensions to property lines are approximate and not a survey. A minimum 2% slope is required for adequate drainage away from the new building. Eavestroughs must be connected to downpipes leading to storm sewers or field tiles. Dimensions are provided in metric and can be converted to imperial by multiplying by 3.281. These notes are crucial for site-level considerations and ensure proper drainage and utility connections.

images.summary: This site plan provides an overview of the property layout, including the proposed new dwelling, septic tank, and leaching bed. The property is bounded by the North, West, East, and South property lines with respective dimensions of 36m, 87m, 89.5m, and 87m. Key dimensions include 12.5m, 35m, 23m, 28.6m, 14.5m, 10.8m, 3m, and 5.5m, indicating distances between various elements on the site. The plan emphasizes the importance of proper layout and spacing for the new building and its associated systems.

LEGEND
INTERIOR FLOOR DRAIN

BASEMENT PLAN NOTES
1. ALL FASTENERS IN TO TREATED WOOD SHALL BE ACQ RATED.
2. PROVIDE LINTEL REINFORCEMENT AS PER DETAILS AND LINTEL SCHEDULE.
3. ICF OPENING REINFORCEMENT: PROVIDE (2) - 10M REBAR TO BE PLACED AROUND PERIMETER OF ALL OPENINGS AND EXTEND A MIN. OF 24" BEYOND OPENINGS OR TO TOP OF WALL. SEE DETAIL 3/D1
4. EXTERIOR FOOTING TILE TO BE DRAINED AWAY FROM BUILDING.
5. ROOF DOWN PIPES SHALL NOT DRAIN INTO AN INTERIOR SUMP PIT.
6. ENSURE ADEQUATE FROST PROTECTION TO FTG. IF BEDROCK INTERFERES WITH FTG. DEPTH PIN FTG. TO BEDROCK c/w 15M REBAR @ 4'-0" o.c. MIN. 6" EMBED. FTG. STEPS NOT TO EXCEED 24" RISE IN 4'-0" LENGTH. INSULATE WALKOUT FDN. FTG. (SEE DETAIL 1/D1)
7. INTERIOR WALLS "IW1" UNLESS NOTED OTHERWISE.
8. ADJUST DECK JOIST SPACING TO 12" o.c. IF USING COMPOSITE DECKING MATERIAL.

images.summary: This image provides detailed notes and schedules for the foundation plan, including concrete lintels, columns, footings, and ICF wall assemblies. Key components include concrete lintels (CL1, CL2), columns (C1, C1a, C2), footings (PF1, PF2, PF3), and floor assemblies (FL1, FL3). The notes specify requirements for fasteners, lintel reinforcement, ICF opening reinforcement, and frost protection for footings. The floor assemblies detail concrete basement floors and deck systems. The ICF wall assemblies outline tie spacing, wall height, and rebar placement. The footing schedule provides dimensions and reinforcement details for concrete pad footings. The concrete lintel schedule specifies load capacities and reinforcement requirements. The column schedule details steel jackposts and stud posts. The concrete pier schedule includes footing tube dimensions and anchor requirements. The framed wall assemblies describe bearing and partition walls with drywall and stud specifications. The beam and ledger schedules provide details for deck beams and ledgers. Section callouts reference specific details for further information.

images.summary: This foundation plan details the layout and specifications for the building's foundation. It includes grid references A, B, C, and D, and section callouts 1/D1, 2/D1, 3/D1, 4/D1, 5/D1, and 6/D1 for further detail. Key components include ICF walls, concrete footings, steel jackposts, and deck joists. The plan specifies dimensions such as 52'-0", 4'-0", 9'-0", 14'-0", 40'-0", and others, indicating the layout of the foundation elements. The deck joists are specified as 2x10 P.T. at 16" o.c. with blocking at midspan, as noted in the plan. This sheet is crucial for ensuring the structural integrity of the building's base.

images.summary: This building section provides a longitudinal view of the structure, detailing wall, floor, and ceiling assemblies. The section includes a girder truss and ridge beam, with vented soffits for attic ventilation. Key dimensions are the top of the roof at 11'-11 15/16" and the top of the wall at 9'-11 1/4". The section highlights various rooms such as the foyer, living room, kitchen, utility, bath, hall, and rec room. Structural elements include a steel beam and column, with insulated concrete forms for foundation walls. The section callout '1/A6' references this view.

images.summary: This detail shows a steel beam and column connection. The steel beam is supported by HSS steel posts, with a 3/8" end plate and a 1/2" x 5 1/2" x 8" top plate secured by 3/4" A325 bolts into the beam flange. The connection includes (3) 1/2" diameter through bolts spaced at 2'-0" on center for securing beam packing. The detail also specifies the use of 5/16" x 6" GRK screws and a 3/4" thick galvanized base plate. The main floor system is indicated as per plan, with the element callout FL2 marking the location. The section callout 2/A6 references this detail on sheet A6.

images.summary: This schedule provides detailed specifications for various assemblies within the building. Wall assemblies include exterior and partition walls with specific insulation, sheathing, and drywall requirements. Floor assemblies detail concrete basement floors and main floor systems, including vapor barriers and drainage stone. Ceiling assemblies specify insulation and finishing materials for vaulted and porch ceilings. Roof assemblies describe pre-engineered wood truss roofs with options for asphalt shingles or metal finishes, including truss spacing and bracing. The ICF wall assemblies outline reinforcement and backfill requirements for below-grade foundation walls, with references to specific details for construction. The schedule ensures all structural components are constructed to precise specifications.

4/D1 CONC. PIER DETAIL
SCALE 3/4" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This detail illustrates a concrete pier used in foundation construction. The pier is reinforced with 15M rebar extending into the footing, with a 2" concrete cover for all reinforcing. The column is fastened to the beam using a Simpson bracket, and the base saddle is secured with 1/2" x 4" Hilti Kwik anchors into the pier. The detail specifies the use of A307 lag screws for fastening, with all fasteners into treated lumber being ACQ rated. The section callout 4/D1 references this detail on sheet D1, providing precise construction guidance for the pier and associated components.

images.summary: This detail shows the reinforcement layout for an ICF wall opening, such as a window or door. It includes 10M top rebar and vertical rebar on both near and far sides, extending the full height of the wall. Horizontal rebar is also placed near and far sides, with a minimum extension of 24" beyond the opening edge. The bottom rebar is specified as per the lintel schedule. The section callout 3/D1 references this detail on sheet D1, ensuring proper reinforcement and structural integrity for openings in ICF walls.

images.summary: This detail illustrates an insulated concrete footing with specific insulation and reinforcement requirements. The insulation notes specify compatible sub-grade insulation types, including 4" thick DOW SM extruded polystyrene and closed cell spray polyurethane foam. The footing detail includes a 6" concrete core with reinforcement, rigid insulation, and a 4'-0" minimum ground cover requirement. The drawing shows a concrete footing reinforced as per plan, with 15M rebar dowels spaced at 4'-0" on center. Additional components include a 4" diameter weeping tile with sand screen and 6" crushed stone directed away from the dwelling. The section callout '1/D1' references this detail on sheet D1.

The section callout '2/D1' references this detail on sheet D1.
